p: Pterodon polygalaeflorus Benth or Commilobium polygalaeflorus, popularly known as “sucupira branca” (white sucupira), is a tree common in the Brazilian Northeast region and abundant in Maranhão and Piauí states ( 15, 16). It has great regional importance because of the widespread use of its shell and seeds in popular medicine as hydroalcoholic infusions for the treatment of chronic diarrhea ( 16), pharyngitis ( 15), and chronic pain and inflammation, such as in arthritis ( 17) and rheumatic diseases.
